_header: Saint Luke says that Jesu Christ
_description: Gospel for the Ninth Sunday after Trinity in the Northern Homily Cycle

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Seint Luc telleþ þat Ihesu CristSeide to hem þat
                    wolde hym list…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Þer we may þe pore seoAnd liue wiþ hym in game
                    and gleo. AMEN.
BodEngPoeta1.Attributed Title: Homo quidam erat diues qui habebat (f. 201rc)
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

CULDd11.First Lines:
SEynt Luke telliþ þat ihesu cristseyde to hem þat
                    wolde him listA riche man had a reue…
CULDd11.Last Lines:
…there we may þe pore folk se& lyue with hem in game
                    & gle

BLAdd22283.First Lines:
SEint luc telleþ þat Ihesu crist[S]Eide to hem þat
                    wolde hym list…
BLAdd22283.Last Lines:
…Þere we may þe pore seoAnd lyue with hem in game
                    & gleo. Amen
BLAdd22283.Note:
The initial ‘S’ of the second line is supplied by the
                    illuminated ‘S’ that opens the first line.
BLAdd22283.Attributed Title: Homo quidam erat diues qui habebat (f. 6rc)
BLAdd22283.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library MS Add. 22283 (‘Simeon’).
         2014; http://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Add_MS_22283.

MinULZ822.First Lines:
Saynt luke says þat ihesu crystesayd tyll þam þat
                    wald hym lystea ryche man he sayd had a gryafe…
MinULZ822.Last Lines:
…þat we may þe pour seAnd lyfe with þam in game
                    and gle

HunHM129.First Lines:
Seynt Luc seyth þat iesus cristSeyd to ham þat woll hym
                    lyst…
HunHM129.Last Lines:
…Þare we may þe pouer seAnd lyue with ham in game
                    and gle
